# title: "teemi"
---

```{r, echo = FALSE, message = FALSE, warning = FALSE}

library(scholar)
library(tibble)
library(dplyr)

# Define the id for Soeren Petersen
id <- 'prKV9NwAAAAJ'

# Get publications from Google Scholar
publications <- scholar::get_publications(id) |> 
  tibble() |> 
  arrange(desc(year))

# Try formatting the publications
formatted_teemi_publication <- tryCatch({
  formatted_publications <- scholar::format_publications(id, "Petersen, S.")
  match <- grep("Teemi", formatted_publications)
  
  if (length(match) > 0) {
    formatted_publications[match]
  } else {
    "Teemi publication not found in scholar profile."
  }
}, error = function(e) {
  "Unable to fetch formatted publication (scholar::format_publications() failed)."
})

```

Teemi is an open-source Python platform for literate, data-driven engineering of biosystems, supporting simulation, structured data capture, and AI-assisted design under FAIR principles. I led its conceptualization and development to streamline the DBTL cycle, enabling scalable, automated, and hypothesis-driven experimentation in synthetic biology. See reference below:

*`r formatted_teemi_publication`*
